alert.note: Alert for Bexar (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued March 01 at 2:08AM CST until March 03 at 3:00AM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR WESTERN PORTIONS OF SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Thursday afternoon through late Thursday night. * WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph, highest in western portions of the county. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 18 percent. * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
